description.div: This blog is part of a multi-blog series titled 7 Elements of Successful Business Continuity Through Digital Transformation.
description.p: In an ever-faster evolving world, enterprises need to be able to gain insights on productivity to improve and reduce, or even eliminate, incidents on their production floors. This was traditionally an isolated operation that was limited by technology and the ability to collect data in real time. The advances in sensor capabilities, connectivity, edge computing, data collection, and machine learning have changed this landscape dramatically over the last decade.

content:encoded.div: This blog is part of a multi-blog series titled 7 Elements of Successful Business Continuity Through Digital Transformation.
content:encoded.p: In an ever-faster evolving world, enterprises need to be able to gain insights on productivity to improve and reduce, or even eliminate, incidents on their production floors. This was traditionally an isolated operation that was limited by technology and the ability to collect data in real time. The advances in sensor capabilities, connectivity, edge computing, data collection, and machine learning have changed this landscape dramatically over the last decade.

item.title: Cloud Computing in Healthcare: The Benefits, Risks & Outlook

img.alt: Cloud Computing in Healthcare: The Benefits, Risks & Outlook

description.p: Over the last decade, enterprises, SMBs and startups across all industries have adopted cloud for its proven benefits. Organizations within the various industries have chosen different adoption journeys based on which cloud services and capabilities they prefer and benefit from. Some organizations are moving into the cloud with a Cloud-First mentality by migrating out of on-premise data center facilities and quickly adapting their business models and operations to account for this. Other organizations which are more regulated, such as healthcare, utilities, and finance, are focusing on specific types of cloud services that can efficiently drive their business operations forward while staying in compliance with regulatory rules and obligations.

img.alt: Cloud Computing in Healthcare: The Benefits, Risks & Outlook

content:encoded.p: Over the last decade, enterprises, SMBs and startups across all industries have adopted cloud for its proven benefits. Organizations within the various industries have chosen different adoption journeys based on which cloud services and capabilities they prefer and benefit from. Some organizations are moving into the cloud with a Cloud-First mentality by migrating out of on-premise data center facilities and quickly adapting their business models and operations to account for this. Other organizations which are more regulated, such as healthcare, utilities, and finance, are focusing on specific types of cloud services that can efficiently drive their business operations forward while staying in compliance with regulatory rules and obligations.

item.author: sean.oneill@pureintegration.com (Sean O’Neill)

item.title: Operational Intelligence in the Next Normal

img.alt: Operational Intelligence in the Next Normal

description.div: This blog is part of a multi-blog series titled 7 Elements of Successful Business Continuity Through Digital Transformation.

em.strong: Your high-performance future is hidden in your data.

description.p: In so many ways on the cusp of 2021, we are in the fight of our lives. Imagine conducting military operations without dynamic intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance (ISR). Enterprise leaders often don’t have the instrumentation required but still must navigate their organizations through turbulence and flak to successfully stay on-mission, along a growth trajectory. The only conceivable way for a military-precise response to threats and overcoming uncertainty is to incorporate insights around the key drivers for your organization into your operational planning.

img.alt: Operational Intelligence in the Next Normal

content:encoded.div: This blog is part of a multi-blog series titled 7 Elements of Successful Business Continuity Through Digital Transformation.

em.strong: Your high-performance future is hidden in your data.

content:encoded.p: In so many ways on the cusp of 2021, we are in the fight of our lives. Imagine conducting military operations without dynamic intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance (ISR). Enterprise leaders often don’t have the instrumentation required but still must navigate their organizations through turbulence and flak to successfully stay on-mission, along a growth trajectory. The only conceivable way for a military-precise response to threats and overcoming uncertainty is to incorporate insights around the key drivers for your organization into your operational planning.

item.author: clayton.liabraaten@pureintegration.com (Clayton LiaBraaten)

item.title: Data Readiness Checklist
item.description:
Business continuity is so much more than power failover and system redundancy. pureIntegration has been partnering with our customers to ensure operational agility and frictionless crisis management with automated orchestration, intelligent cloud management, and advanced application monitoring for over 15 years—even amid the most unusual.
This 6-minute exercise will help you understand any gaps—and more importantly opportunities—when it comes to your data readiness.
item.content:encoded:
Business continuity is so much more than power failover and system redundancy. pureIntegration has been partnering with our customers to ensure operational agility and frictionless crisis management with automated orchestration, intelligent cloud management, and advanced application monitoring for over 15 years—even amid the most unusual.

item.title: What I Learned: WICT “My Climb Up the Corporate Ladder”

img.alt: What I Learned: WICT “My Climb Up the Corporate Ladder”

description.p: On August 26, I participated as a panelist on the WICT Greater Philadelphia’s Speaker Series event, "My Climb Up the Corporate Ladder." What a delight to share an hour with three incredible women, all forces within their own right.
